metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45105 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache Log4j2 versions 2.0-alpha1 through 2.16.0 (excluding 2.12.3 and 2.3.1) did not protect from uncontrolled recursion from self-referential lookups. This allows an attacker with control over Thread Context Map data to cause a denial of service when a crafted string is interpreted. This issue was fixed in Log4j 2.17.0, 2.12.3, and 2.3.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-45105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblog4j2-java - 2.17.0-0.21.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache-log4j2 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.17.0-0.21.10.1').
